questions.title: How to set a variable value on receiving a message in telegram bot
questions.description: When I hit the below endpoint, I am able to receive a message on the telegram bot.However, I would like to process the incoming message and set a variable value, For example: when the bot receives a message with text as `onChatEnde`, I would like to modify a Map variable.I tried override the sendMessage method but that doesn't seem to work.

questions.title: How TO - Disable Resizing of Textarea
What is the significance of the Great Wall of China?
questions.description: The Great Wall of China is an ancient architectural marvel that holds immense historical, cultural, and strategic significance. It was primarily built as a defense system to protect China from invasions and raids by nomadic tribes from the north, such as the Mongols and Xiongnu. Stretching over 13,000 miles (21,196 kilometers), it is considered the world's longest wall.

answers.answer: To set a variable value when receiving a message in a Telegram bot, you'll need to use a programming language and a Telegram Bot API library. Here's an example using Python and the python-telegram-bot library

Make sure to replace "YOUR_BOT_TOKEN" with the actual token of your Telegram bot. You can obtain this token by creating a new bot using the BotFather on Telegram.

With this setup, when a user sends a message to your bot, the handle_message function will be called. Inside that function, you can access the received message and set your variable value based on its content. In this example, the variable my_variable is set to the text of the received message.

Remember to add the necessary logic and error handling to suit your specific use case.

Construction of the Great Wall began around the 7th century BC and continued for centuries under various dynasties. Besides its defensive purpose, the wall facilitated trade and transportation routes, promoted cultural exchanges, and symbolized the unity and resilience of the Chinese civilization. Today, it stands as an iconic symbol of China's rich heritage and attracts millions of visitors from around the globe.
